{{Infobox scientist |name=PZ Myers |birth_name=Paul Zachary Myers |image=Pzm london lg.jpg |image_size=250px |caption=PZ Myers in [[London]] in 2006 |birth_date={{birth date and age|1957|3|9}} |residence=[[United States]] |field=[[Evolutionary developmental biology]] |work_institution=[[University of Minnesota Morris]] |alma_mater=[[University of Washington]]
[[University of Oregon]] |known_for=[[Pharyngula (blog)]] |birth_place = [[Kent, Washington]], U.S.}} '''Paul Zachary Myers''' (born March 9, 1957) is an American biologist who founded and writes the ''[[Pharyngula (blog)|Pharyngula]]'' science-[[blog]]. He is associate-professor of [[biology]] at the [[University of Minnesota Morris]] (UMM)[http://www.morris.umn.edu/academics/biology/faculty/#myersp PZ Myers Biology Faculty] from [[University of Minnesota Morris]] where he works in the field of [[developmental biology]].https://academics.morris.umn.edu/biology/biology-faculty He is a critic of [[intelligent design]] (ID), the [[creationist]] movement, and other [[pseudoscience|pseudoscientific]] concepts.{{cite news|url= https://www.nytimes.com/2010/10/16/us/16beliefs.html?_r=2|title= BELIEFS; Atheists Debate How Pushy to Be|last= Oppenheimer|first= Mark|date= 2010-10-16|work= The New York Times|page= 12|accessdate= 2010-12-19}} In 2006 the journal ''[[Nature (journal)|Nature]]'' listed Myers's ''Pharyngula'' as the top-ranked blog by a scientist based on popularity.{{cite journal|year= 2006|title= Top five science blogs|journal= Nature|volume= 442|issue= 7098|pages= 9–9|issn= 0028-0836|doi= 10.1038/442009a|url= http://www.nature.com/nature/journal/v442/n7098/full/442009a.html|pmid=16823420}} Myers received the [[American Humanist Association]]'s 2009 Humanist of the Year award and the International Humanist Award in 2011. [[Asteroid]] [[153298 Paulmyers]] is named in his honor. {{cite web |url= http://bluecollarscientist.com/2008/03/25/pz-myers-and-153298-paulmyers/ |title= PZ Myers and (153298) Paulmyers|first= Jeff|last= Medkeff |authorlink= Jeffrey S. Medkeff|date= 2008-03-25 |accessdate= 2008-03-25 |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20080807174700/http://bluecollarscientist.com/2008/03/25/pz-myers-and-153298-paulmyers/ |archivedate= 2008-08-07 }} ==Early life== Myers was born March 9, 1957, the eldest of six children in [[Kent, Washington]]; his mother is of [[Swedish American|Swedish]] and [[Norwegian American|Norwegian]] descent.{{cite web|last=Myers|first=PZ|title=My Swedish/Norwegian mother, you mean?|url=https://twitter.com/pzmyers/status/82623020128153600|publisher=Twitter|date=June 19, 2011}} Regarding his ancestry, Myers wrote: "I'm only half Scandinavian. The blood has been thinned with that of those domesticated English and Irish and Scots."{{cite web|last=Myers|first=PZ|title=Have I ever told you how proud I am of my Scandinavian ancestry?|url=http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/2011/02/have_i_ever_told_you_how_proud.php|work=Pharyngula|publisher=ScienceBlogs|accessdate=July 24, 2011|date=February 5, 2011}} He was named "Paul Zachary", after his grandfather, but preferred the initials PZ to being called "Little Paul". He has described his family as "probably what would be called the working poor nowadays", and noted that "when I was growing up I was called [[white trash]] more than a few times".{{cite web|last=Myers|first=PZ|title=There are no marching morons|url=http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/2007/05/08/there-are-no-marching-morons/|work=Pharyngula|publisher=ScienceBlogs|accessdate=January 15, 2016|date=May 8, 2007}} He claims to have been a "[[science]] [[geek]]" from an early age, gaining an interest in [[zoology]] and [[marine biology]] from studying the insides of fish while on fishing trips with his father. Growing up, Myers attended an [[Evangelical Lutheran Church in America]] (ELCA) church.Myers, PZ (June 2, 2013). "[http://freethoughtblogs.com/pharyngula/2013/06/02/an-atheist-goes-to-church-1stlc/ An atheist goes to church — 1stLC]." Prior to his [[Confirmation (Lutheran Church)|confirmation]], Myers says, "I started thinking, you know, I don't believe a word of this." Now an [[atheist]], Myers comments widely on his blog about science, education, atheism and religion.{{cite web|url=http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/2006/03/left_or_right_religion_and_pol.php|title=Left or Right, religion and politics don't mix|accessdate=2007-08-22|date=2006-03-13|publisher=Pharyngula|first=PZ|last=Myers|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070212034936/http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/2006/03/left_or_right_religion_and_pol.php|archive-date=2007-02-12|dead-url=yes|df=}}http://thehumanist.org/humanist/09_nov_dec/Myers.html ==Education and activism== Myers graduated from [[Kent-Meridian High School]] in 1975 and subsequently attended [[DePauw University]] in Indiana on a full [[scholarship]].{{cite web|url=http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/2010/07/my_week_in_the_pacific_northwe.php?|title=My week in the Pacific Northwest|publisher=[[ScienceBlogs]]|date=2010-07-25|accessdate=2010-07-25|quote=Saturday at 5:00pm on I'll be attending…my 35th high school reunion with a gang of strange people I haven't seen in decades. You aren't invited unless you were also a graduate of Kent-Meridian High School, Class of 1975}} However, he returned home the next year after his father suffered a [[myocardial infarction|heart attack]]. He then graduated from the [[University of Washington]] in 1979 with [[Bachelor of Science]] in [[zoology]]. Myers drifted away from this field toward [[evolutionary developmental biology]] and obtained a [[Doctor of Philosophy|PhD]] in Biology from the [[University of Oregon]]."[http://freethoughtblogs.com/pharyngula/about/ About PZ Myers] [[File:PZ Myers at Skepticon 7.jpg|thumb|left|300px|PZ Myers presents his talk, "You, too, can know more molecular genetics than a creationist!" at [[Skepticon]] in 2014.]] A self-styled "godless [[Modern liberalism in the United States|liberal]]"Tagline on [http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula Pharyngula]: "Evolution, development, and random biological ejaculations from a godless liberal." and outspoken [[atheist]], he is a vocal critic of all forms of religion, superstition, supernaturalism, spirituality and [[pseudoscience]]. He is quoted as having "nothing but contempt" for intelligent design, arguing that it is "fundamentally dishonest".{{cite journal|url=http://www.citypages.com/2005-11-23/news/the-mad-scientist/3|title=The Mad Scientist, interview with PZ Myers|date=November 23, 2005|first=Mike|last=Mosedale|volume=26|issue=1303|accessdate=2007-08-22|journal=City Pages|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080802000603/http://citypages.com/2005-11-23/news/the-mad-scientist/3|archive-date=2008-08-02|dead-url=yes|df=}} He is also an outspoken supporter of [[sex-positive feminism]].{{cite web|url=http://freethoughtblogs.com/pharyngula/2012/02/08/the-not-so-amazing-atheist-self-immolates/|title=The not-so-Amazing Atheist self-immolates |publisher=Freethoughblogs |accessdate=2012-09-29| quote=The feminism I embrace is sex-positive. It includes heterosexual men and women, homosexual men and women, trans men and women, and every kink and twist you can imagine.}} Myers believes women should make their own sexual choices without outside pressure.[http://freethoughtblogs.com/pharyngula/2012/09/06/im-ready-to-be-divisive/ I’m ready to be divisive][http://freethoughtblogs.com/pharyngula/2013/08/07/carrie-poppy-tells-all/ Carrie Poppy tells all] In 2009 Myers was named the [[American Humanist Association]]'s "Humanist of the Year".{{cite web|url=http://www.americanhumanist.org/AHA/Humanists_of_the_Year|title=American Humanist Association: Humanist of the year|publisher=American Humanist Association|accessdate=2013-06-06|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120717065124/http://www.americanhumanist.org/AHA/Humanists_of_the_Year|archivedate=2012-07-17|df=}} In April 2015, [[Atheist Ireland]] issued an official announcement, apologizing that they had given Myers "public platforms in Ireland, both at the World Atheist Convention in 2011, and at our international conference in 2013 on Empowering Women Through Secularism" and that now it is "publicly dissociating itself from the hurtful and dehumanising, hateful and violent, unjust and defamatory rhetoric of the atheist blogger PZ Myers".{{cite web|title=Atheist Ireland publicly dissociates itself from the harmful and hateful rhetoric of PZ Myers|url=http://atheist.ie/2015/04/atheist-ireland-dissociates-from-pz-myers/|publisher=Atheist Ireland, Executive Committee|accessdate=8 April 2015}} In 2017, PZ Myers who formerly considered himself one of the "New Atheists", disassociated himself with the [[New Atheist]] label. Describing the label as being applied "against our protests, because we were all aware that there was nothing new about it. Maybe we were more aggressive, or maybe suddenly people were listening to us, but really, it was the same old atheism with a fancy artisan label", Myers prefers to be simply referred to as an atheist.[https://freethoughtblogs.com/pharyngula/2017/07/31/the-new-atheism-is-dead-long-live-atheism/ The New Atheism is dead. Long live atheism.] ==Post-graduate career== Myers has taught and researched at the [[University of Oregon]], the [[University of Utah]] and [[Temple University]]. He is currently an associate professor of biology at the [[University of Minnesota|University of Minnesota's]] [[Morris, Minnesota|Morris]] campus. He is a member of ''Minnesota Citizens for Science Education'',{{cite web|url=http://www.mnscience.org/index.php?id=14|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100330074138/http://www.mnscience.org/index.php?id=14|archivedate=30 March 2010|title= MnCSE Scientific Advisory Board|work=Minnesota Citizens for Science Education}} and cultivates an interest in [[cephalopod]]s.{{citation needed|date=August 2016}} ==Blogging and writing== Myers has been active on the internet. He was involved in scientific debates on [[USENET]] surrounding the growing [[creationism|creationist]] movement. He was a founding member of [[The Panda's Thumb (blog)|The Panda's Thumb blog]]. In June 2002, he started his website ''Pharyngula.org'', which morphed into a blog now hosted by [[ScienceBlogs]][http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/], ''Pharyngula'', Science Blogs and Freethought Blogs.[http://freethoughtblogs.com/pharyngula/about/], ''About >> Pharyngula'', Freethought Blogs ===Pharyngula=== {{Main article|Pharyngula (blog)}} Pharyngula is Myers's personal [[weblog]], promoted as "Evolution, development, and random biological ejaculations from a godless liberal."[http://freethoughtblogs.com/pharyngula], ''Pharyngula'', Freethought Blogs The topics Myers covers are eclectic, delving into the non-scientific as well as scientific. While Pharyngula includes many articles discussing breaking science news and research, the blog has become particularly well known for ridicule of [[intelligent design]] and of attempts to insert it into science education. In 2006, the science journal ''[[Nature (journal)|Nature]]'' listed Pharyngula as the top-ranked blog written by a scientist.{{cite journal|url=http://www.nature.com/nature/journal/v442/n7098/full/442009a.html|volume=442|issue=7098|pages=9–9|title=Top five science blogs|date=2006-07-05| accessdate=2009-07-15|doi=10.1038/442009a|first=Decla |last=Butler|journal=Nature|pmid=16823420}} Pharyngula.org was started on June 19, 2002.{{cite web |url=http://www.alexa.com/data/details/main?q=Pharyngula.org&url=pharyngula.org |title=Related Info for: pharyngula.org/ |publisher=[[Alexa.com]] |accessdate=2006-09-03}} It started out as an experiment in writing instruction for a class. Students were required to submit mini-essays to be published online. After the project was finished, Myers still had the web-publishing software, and started to use it himself. The blog is named after his favorite stage in [[embryonic development]], the [[pharyngula]] stage. Pharyngula moved to hosting at [[ScienceBlogs]], a project of [[Seed (magazine)|Seed Magazine]], in 2005. On Pharyngula, Myers has repeatedly denounced the [[Discovery Institute]], [[Answers in Genesis]], and other creationist websites, as well as offering rebuttals to [[Intelligent Design]], pointing out that its claims are pseudoscientific. Other posts on Pharyngula cover a broad variety of topics that interest Myers. These include [[cephalopod]]s; science; religion; local, national and international politics, particularly those involving science and/or education; superstition; and evolutionary developmental biology. Myers dismissed the Discovery Institute's petition [[A Scientific Dissent From Darwinism]], stating that the scientists listed didn't have credentials relevant to [[Biology]], and that the number of them was minuscule compared to the scientific community as a whole. On his blog in 2007, Myers reviewed [[Stuart Pivar]]'s book ''Lifecode'', which argues that self-organization at the [[embryo]]nic and [[fetus|fetal]] stages determine the development and final structure of organisms.{{cite web|url=http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/2007/07/lifecode.php|title=Lifecode|accessdate=2007-08-21|last=Myers|first=PZ|date=2007-07-12|publisher=Scienceblogs|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070907142321/http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/2007/07/lifecode.php|archive-date=2007-09-07|dead-url=yes|df=}}{{cite web |url=http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/2007/07/lifecode_from_egg_to_embryo_by.php |title=Lifecode: From egg to embryo by self-organization |accessdate=2007-08-21 |last=Myers |first=PZ |date=2007-07-17 |publisher=Scienceblogs |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070906043449/http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/2007/07/lifecode_from_egg_to_embryo_by.php |archive-date=2007-09-06 |dead-url=yes |df= }}{{cite web |url=http://blog.sciam.com/index.php?title=pz_myers_scienceblogs_com_s_lead_blogger&more=1&c=1&tb=1&pb=1 |title=PZ Myers, ScienceBlogs.com's lead blogger, is being sued for libel |accessdate=2007-08-21 |date=2007-08-20 |publisher=Scientific American | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070823162247/http://blog.sciam.com/index.php?title=pz_myers_scienceblogs_com_s_lead_blogger&more=1&c=1&tb=1&pb=1 | archivedate=2007-08-23}} Myers reviewed the book negatively, stating that the diagrams and ideas in the book arose from Pivar's imagination and had no basis in actual evidence.
How his theory can be reconciled with a large body of embryological evidence that directly contradicts virtually all of it is not clear, and Pivar has chosen not to address any of it. And a book full of geometrically interesting sketches neither explains nor supports Pivar's theory.… Theories are supposed to explain observation and experiment. You don't come up with a theory first, and then invent the evidence to support it.
After some discussion in the comments threads of Pharyngula, Pivar sued Myers for libel. Within a week Pivar withdrew the lawsuit, stating that "the real issue got sidelined" and that his problem was more with [[Seed (magazine)|Seed Media Group]].[http://citypages.com/databank/28/1396/article15832.asp Monkey's Uncle] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070930204455/http://citypages.com/databank/28/1396/article15832.asp |date=2007-09-30 }}, ''City Pages'', September 5, 2007 In addition to articles about keeping religion out of science education, church-state separation, and complaints of misdeeds done in the name of religion, Myers continues to write about science in the disciplines of evolution,[http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/science/evolution/] ''Pharyngula: Science: evolution'' palaeontology,[http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/science/fossils/], ''Pharyngula: science: fossils'' genetics,[http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/science/genetics/], ''Pharyngula: science: genetics'' development,[http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/science/development/], ''Pharyngula: science: development'' and molecular biology.[http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/science/molecular_biology/], ''Pharyngula: science: molecular biology'' In 2012, Myers announced that Chris Clarke, an environmentalist and blogger, would become Pharyngula's co-author.[http://freethoughtblogs.com/pharyngula/2012/09/06/pharyngula-is-about-to-add-a-co-blogger/ Pharyngula is About to Add a Co-Blogger ] Clarke left the blog in August 2013, partly because of the perceived unpleasantness of ''Pharyngula'' commenters. http://freethoughtblogs.com/pharyngula/2013/09/01/farewell-chris/ ===Book=== Myers's book, ''The Happy Atheist,'' was published by [[Random House]] in August, 2013.{{cite web |title=Random House: The Happy Atheist by P.Z. Myers |url=http://www.randomhouse.com/book/203768/the-happy-atheist-by-pz-myers |year=2012 |accessdate=2013-07-26}} It is largely a compilation of previous blog posts.[[Branch, Glenn]] (August 8, 2013). [http://www.readcube.com/articles/10.1038/500149a "Godless chronicles: Glenn Branch goes for a dip in the antitheologic."]. ''[[Nature (journal)|Nature]]''. Vol 500, p 149. The book has been well-received by critics.{{citation needed|date=February 2018}} Fellow blogger Greg Laden celebrates "the level of refinement of his writing" and noting that "these essays actually have a different feel to them".{{cite web |url=http://scienceblogs.com/gregladen/2013/06/25/pz-myers-is-the-happy-atheist/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2017-08-29 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170829120323/http://scienceblogs.com/gregladen/2013/06/25/pz-myers-is-the-happy-atheist/ |archivedate=2017-08-29 |df= }} ===Eucharist incident=== {{see also|Host desecration#2008 controversy in the US|Catholic League (U.S.)#Eucharist incident}} A controversy arose in July 2008 over a Pharyngula blog entry written by Myers expressing amazement at news reports of [[death threat]]s issued to [[University of Central Florida]] Student Senator Webster Cook. On June 29, 2008, Cook attended a [[Mass (Catholic Church)|Catholic Mass]] being held in the student union at UCF by a Catholic student group that receives funding from the student government. Cook received the [[Eucharist in the Catholic Church|Catholic Eucharist host]] but did not consume it immediately. He said later that he wanted to take it back to his seat to show a friend, but when stopped he pretended to put it in his mouth until back at his seat, then a church leader made forcible attempts to take the wafer from him.{{cite web|url=http://www.wftv.com/news/16798008/detail.html|title='Body Of Christ' Snatched From Church, Held Hostage By UCF Student|accessdate=2008-07-11|date=2008-07-09|publisher=WFTV|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080711042722/http://www.wftv.com/news/16798008/detail.html|archivedate=2008-07-11|df=}} Cook stored the host at his home, then returned it one week later after receiving e-mail threats and pleas.{{cite web|url=http://ffrf.libsyn.com/index.php?post_id=361015|title=Radio interview with "Webster Cook, student senator and non-eater of communion wafers"|date=2008-07-19|format=online radio|publisher= Freethought Radio|quote=Tune in to hear the inside story about the young Orlando student whom Catholics have accused of committing a 'hate crime' for not eating a communion wafer!|accessdate=2008-07-28}}{{cite web|url=http://www.wftv.com/news/16806050/detail.html|title='Body Of Christ" Returned To Church After Student Receives Email Threats|accessdate=2008-07-25|date=2008-07-09|publisher=WFTV|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080725000057/http://www.wftv.com/news/16806050/detail.html|archivedate=2008-07-25|df=}} [[Bill Donohue]], President of the [[Catholic League (U.S.)|Catholic League]], described the student's actions as "beyond hate speech" and said that "All options should be on the table, including expulsion."{{cite web|url= http://www.catholicleague.org/release.php?id=1458|title=Florida Student Abuses Eucharist|accessdate=2008-07-25|date=2008-07-07|publisher=The Catholic League|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110825035803/http://www.catholicleague.org/release.php?id=1458|archivedate=25 August 2011}} In his July 8 blog entry, Myers criticized the reaction to Cook's act. Myers described the level of harassment including multiple death threats leveled against the student, and accusations against the student which included [[hate crime]], [[kidnapping]], and intent to [[Host desecration|desecrate the Eucharist]] which Catholics consider a [[mortal sin]].{{cite web|url=http://www.myfoxorlando.com/dpp/news/Student_Who_Took_Religious_Icon_Getting_Death_Threats|title= Student Who Took Religious Icon Getting Death Threats|accessdate=2009-11-18|date=2008-07-09|first=Cheryl|last=Getuiza|publisher= My [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] Orlando}} Myers expressed outrage that [[Fox News Channel]] appeared to be inciting readers to cause further problems for the student, and ridiculed reports that armed guards would attend the next mass. Myers suggested that if any of his readers could acquire some consecrated Eucharistic hosts for him, he would treat the wafers "with profound disrespect and heinous cracker abuse, all photographed and presented here on the web."{{cite web|url=http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/2008/07/its_a_goddamned_cracker.php|title=IT'S A FRACKIN’ CRACKER!|accessdate=2008-07-11|date=2008-07-08|publisher=Pharyngula|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080712015833/http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/2008/07/its_a_goddamned_cracker.php|archivedate=2008-07-12|df=}} Myers was criticized from both religious and non-religious quarters. The Catholic League accused Myers of [[anti-Catholic]] [[bigotry]],{{cite web|url= http://www.startribune.com/lifestyle/faith/24313139.html|title=Communion wafer held 'hostage' raises holy heck|date=July 11, 2008|work=Minneapolis Star Tribune|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090204001624/http://www.startribune.com/lifestyle/faith/24313139.html|archivedate=February 4, 2009}} described his proposal as a threat to desecrate what [[Transubstantiation|Catholics hold to be the Body of Christ]], and sent a letter asking the University of Minnesota and the Minnesota State Legislature to take action against Myers.{{cite web|url=http://www.catholicleague.org/release.php?id=1459|title=Minnesota Prof Pledges to Desecrate Eucharist|accessdate=2008-07-11|date=2008-07-10|publisher=The Catholic League|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080713023423/http://www.catholicleague.org/release.php?id=1459|archivedate=2008-07-13|df=}} The Catholic League argued that, as the Pharyngula website was accessible via a link from the University of Minnesota's website, it should be bound by the university's code of conduct, which requires faculty to be "respectful, fair and civil" when dealing with others. Joe Foley, a member of the Board of the [[Secular Student Alliance]], wrote on the organization's website that Myers had "crossed the line" from "playful satire" to "masturbatory condescension".[http://www.secularstudents.org/node/2168 J. Foley, "Wafergate: PZ Myers Crossed the Line"], secularstudents.org, Aug. 3, 2008 Foley concluded, "if open-minded believers are willing to join us in polite dialogue, we need to be ready to welcome them with more than ridicule and pranks." Subsequently, Myers explained to the ''[[Star Tribune]]'' that while his post was "satire and protest," he had received death threats regarding the incident but was not taking them too seriously.{{wikinews|Woman fired over husband's email threat to Minnesota professor|date=July 16, 2008}} In a talk show featuring Myers on ''Catholic Radio International'', hosted by Jeff Gardner, Myers confirmed that he had been sent an unspecified number of consecrated hosts and said that he intended to “subject them to heinous cracker abuse.” When asked by Gardner to explain why he must do so, Myers said that Donohue of the Catholic League was insisting that he acknowledge the Body of Christ in the Eucharist. Gardner pointed out that Donohue had no authority to insist on such acknowledgment. The show host then asked Myers which individual possessing the [[Magisterium|Magisterial]] authority of the Catholic Church had insisted that he recognize the Body of Christ in the Eucharist. Myers replied that no one from the Catholic Church had contacted him.{{cite web|url=http://www.catholicradiointernational.com/heartofmatter.php|title=The Heart Of The Matter On Catholic Radio International|2008-07-10|work=We Need To Talk|publisher=Catholic Radio International|accessdate=2008-07-18}} On July 24, 2008, Myers, in his post, "The Great Desecration," wrote that he had pierced through the "goddamned cracker" with a rusty nail, which he also used to pierce a few ripped-out pages of the [[Qur'an]] (in English translation, not the original Arabic) and ''[[The God Delusion]]'', and had simply thrown them all in the trash along with old coffee grounds and a banana peel. He provided a photograph of these items in the garbage, and wrote that nothing must be held sacred, encouraging people to question everything. In addition, he described the history of allegations of [[host desecration]], emphasizing the frequent use of such allegations in medieval Europe to justify [[anti-Semitism]].{{cite web|url=http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/2008/07/the_great_desecration.php|title=Pharyngula: The Great Desecration|first=PZ|last=Myers |date=2008-07-24|work=Pharyngula|publisher=[[ScienceBlogs]]|accessdate=2008-07-24}} The following day, University of Minnesota, Morris (UMM) Chancellor stated: "I believe that behaviors that discriminate against or harass individuals or groups on the basis of their religious beliefs are reprehensible" and that the school "affirms the freedom of a faculty member to speak or write as a public citizen without institutional discipline or restraint."WALSH, PAUL [http://www.startribune.com/local/25896599.html?location_refer=Homepage:latestNews:4 Morris chancellor defends instructor who defiled Eucharist, tore Qur'an] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090827022715/http://www.startribune.com/local/25896599.html?location_refer=Homepage:latestNews:4 |date=2009-08-27 }} Star Tribune, July 25, 2008 ==Science activism== ===Interview and screening of ''Expelled''=== In April 2007 Myers was interviewed for what he was told would be a documentary titled ''Crossroads'', purportedly about science and religion.{{cite news|first=PZ|last= Myers|title=I'm gonna be a MOVIE STAR|url=http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/2007/08/im_gonna_be_a_movie_star.php#more|work=|publisher=[[Pharyngula (blog)]]|date= 2007-08-22|accessdate=2008-05-28}} However, in September 2007, executive producer [[Mark Mathis]] announced that the film was ''[[Expelled: No Intelligence Allowed]]'' about perceived censorship of intelligent design supporters in academia and elsewhere.{{cite news|first=Cornelia|last=Dean|title=Scientists Feel Miscast in Film on Life's Origin|url= https://www.nytimes.com/2007/09/27/science/27expelled.html?_r=2&oref=slogin&oref=slogin|publisher=[[The New York Times]]|date=2007-09-27|accessdate=2008-05-28}} Regarding the discrepancy of focus, Myers wrote: "I mean, seriously, not telling one of the sides in a debate about what the subject might be and then leading him around randomly to various topics, with the intent of later editing it down to the parts that just make the points you want, is the video version of [[quote-mining]] and is fundamentally dishonest." On March 20, 2008, Myers was [[Expelled: No Intelligence Allowed#PZ Myers and Richard Dawkins at Minnesota pre-release screening|denied entry into a screening]] of ''Expelled: No Intelligence Allowed'' at the [[Mall of America]] in [[Minneapolis]]. He was waiting with his family and guests to attend a private screening after having reserved seats for himself and guests under his own name using the freely available online procedure set up by the film's promoters. Shortly before the film started, a security guard told him that the producer [[Mark Mathis]] had instructed that Myers be removed from the premises. After telling his family of this Myers went to a nearby Apple store and [[blog]]ged about his amusement that they had expelled him, but allowed his guest entry to see the film—British [[evolutionary biologist]] [[Richard Dawkins]], who had also been interviewed for the film under similar circumstances.{{cite web|url=http://scienceblogs.com/pharyngula/2008/03/expelled.php|title=Pharyngula: EXPELLED!|accessdate=2008-03-23|first=PZ|last=Myers|date= 2008-03-20|quote=There is a rich, deep kind of irony that must be shared. I'm blogging this from the Apple store in the Mall of America, because I'm too amused to want to wait until I get back to my hotel room. I went to attend a screening of the creationist propaganda movie, Expelled, a few minutes ago. Well, I tried… but I was Expelled!}} In a question and answer session at the end of the film Dawkins asked why Myers had been excluded, and later said that "if anyone had a right to see the film, it was [Myers]. The incompetence, on a public relations level, is beyond belief."{{cite web|url=http://www.twincities.com/ci_8653837|title=Biology prof expelled from screening of 'Expelled' - TwinCities.com|accessdate=2008-03-21|first=Chris|last=Hewitt|date=2008-03-21|publisher=[[St. Paul Pioneer Press|The Pioneer Press]]}} The saga has been described by Dawkins as "an incredible piece of inept public relations" on the part of the film's producers.[http://media.richarddawkins.net/video/2008/RDPZweb.mov Discussion on PZ Myers being expelled from Expelled]. The [[Richard Dawkins Foundation for Reason and Science]]. Retrieved March 22, 2008 ===Creation Museum visit=== [[File:PZ Myers (1).jpg|thumb|Myers at the Creation Museum]] Myers's engagement as keynote speaker at the 2009 [[Secular Student Alliance]] Conference in [[Columbus, Ohio]]{{cite web|title=Secular Student Alliance|url= http://www.secularstudents.org/conference|accessdate=2009-08-17}} developed into an August 7, 2009 trip, in which 304 attendees visited the nearby [[Creation Museum]] in [[Petersburg, Boone County, Kentucky|Petersburg, Kentucky]].{{cite web|title=A firebrand visits Creation Museum|first=Devin|last=Powell|url= http://www.startribune.com/lifestyle/53237252.html|work=StarTribune.com|publisher=Star Tribune|location=Minneapolis|date=2009-08-14|accessdate=2009-08-17}} Beforehand, there was a flurry of heated blog posts which resulted in the museum sending a warning letter{{rp|To whom?}} detailing appropriate behavior.{{cn|date=July 2017}} The visit resulted in two reported incidents. In one, a student wearing a T-shirt that read "There's probably no God. Now stop worrying and enjoy yourself"{{cn|date=July 2017}} It was also reported that a student was asked to leave the Creation Museum after a family visiting the museum complained to staff that they saw him "laughing at the exhibits". [[Ken Ham]] however, denied that the student was told to leave, claiming that a photographer who witnessed the incident was the one who was removed.{{cite web | url=http://blogs.answersingenesis.org/blogs/ken-ham/2009/08/08/the-day-285-atheistsagnostics-visited-the-creation-museum/ | title=The Day 285 Atheists/Agnostics Visited the Creation Museum | publisher=Answers in Genesis | work=Around the World with Ken Ham | date=August 8, 2009 | accessdate=June 1, 2011 | author=Ham, Ken | quote=The bigger incident at this particular moment is recounted here by Dan Mangus, our museum’s director, who saw much of what went on with the young man talking with me: “When you addressed the young man to have him apologize to the offended family, a gentleman stepped from the prof’s mob to try to film the action and listen in. I stepped in front of his camera and informed him it was a private conversation. He kept sidestepping me and being rude about it, like I didn’t exist, so I motioned for an officer to escort him away. Our officer said: ‘Sir, will you come with me?’ The photographer said nothing; he just followed him. Nothing else was said. He escorted him to the crosswalk. That’s when he made the comment that he hadn’t done anything.” I mention this in detail because Lyz and many SSA members were (falsely) told that the young man was thrown out, and that is now being reported by bloggers, and we want to set the record straight. Only one person—the videographer—was ushered out.}} ==Appearances== Myers has been invited to speak about science, rationalism, or atheism at conferences, symposia, and other events. * [[Global Atheist Convention]] in [[Melbourne, Australia]], 2012 * [[Reason Rally]], 24 March 2012 * [[Secular Student Alliance]] Conference in [[Columbus, Ohio]], 2009 * [[Glasgow Skeptics]] in the Pub, 2011{{cite web|title=PZ Myers on the Pharyngula at Glasgow Skeptics|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=115DdMmp2Bw|publisher=[[Glasgow Skeptics]]|accessdate=18 April 2014}} In July, 2013, Freethought Blogs organized an online virtual conference called FtBCon or FtB Conscience. Pius Thomas D'Souza of Agrar becomes bishop of Ajmer|publisher=mangaloretoday.com|access-date=2017-10-05}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.ucanindia.in/diocesan-directory/indian/bishop/pius-thomas-dsouza/10|title=Pius Thomas D'Souza|publisher=UCAN India|access-date=2017-10-05}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.apostolicnunciatureindia.com/DiocesesofIndiaDispFull.aspx?DID=194|title=Apostolic Nunciature, India & Nepal|website=www.apostolicnunciatureindia.com|access-date=2017-10-28}} == Early life and education == Pius Thomas D'Souza was born in Agrar, [[Mangalore]], India on 4 May 1954. He completed his doctorate in canon law from the [[Pontifical Urban University]], Rome.{{Cite web|url=http://directory.ucanews.com/bishops/bishop-dsouza/634|title=Bishop Pius Thomas D’Souza {{!}} Bishop of Ajmer Diocese Pius Thomas D’Souza {{!}} Ucanews|website=directory.ucanews.com|access-date=2017-10-28}} == Priesthood == Pius was ordained a priest on 28 March 1982 for the [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Lucknow|diocese of Lucknow]] initially but later he was Incardinated to the [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Bareilly|diocese of Bareilly]], India on 19 January 1989.{{Cite web|url=http://www.catholic-hierarchy.org/bishop/bdsouzapt.html|title=Bishop Pius Thomas D’Souza [Catholic-Hierarchy]|last=Cheney|first=David M.|website=www.catholic-hierarchy.org|access-date=2017-10-28}} == Episcopate == He was Appointed Bishop of Ajmer on 3 November 2012 by [[Pope Benedict XVI]] and consecrated by [[Salvatore Pennacchio]] on 19 January 2013{{Cite news|url=http://www.thecsf.org/2012/11/06/fr-d%E2%80%99souza-appointed-ajmer-bishop/|title=Fr. D’Souza appointed Ajmer bishop|work=The CSF|access-date=2017-10-28|language=en-US}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.catholic-hierarchy.org/bishop/bdsouzapt.html|title=Bishop Pius Thomas D'Souza|publisher=Catholic-Hierarchy|last=Cheney|first=David M.|access-date=2017-10-05}} at the Immaculate Conception Cathedral.{{Cite web|url=http://www.daijiworld.com/news/newsDisplay.aspx?newsID=154410|title=Mangalorean Fr Pius D'Souza Appointed Bishop of Ajmer|access-date=2017-10-28}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.daijiworld.com/news/newsDisplay.aspx?newsID=154410|title=Mangalorean Fr Pius D'Souza Appointed Bishop of Ajmer|access-date=2017-10-05}}{{Cite web|url=http://directory.ucanews.com/bishops/bishop-dsouza/634|title=Bishop Pius Thomas D'Souza|publisher=Ucanews|access-date=2017-10-05}} == References == {{reflist}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:D'Souza, Pius Thomas}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1954 births]] [[Category:Indian Roman Catholic bishops]] {{india-RC-bishop-stub}} [[Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Benedict XVI]] [[Category:Pontifical Urbaniana University alumni]]

{{Infobox person | name = Russell Simmons | image = Russell Simmons 2012 Shankbone.JPG | caption = Simmons at the 2012 [[Tribeca Film Festival]] premiere of ''[[Mansome]]'' | birth_name = Russell Wendell Simmons | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1957|10|4}} | birth_place = [[Queens]], [[New York City]], [[New York (state)|New York]], U.S. | nationality = American | alma_mater = [[City College of New York]] | occupation = Co-founder of [[Def Jam Recordings|Def Jam]] and founder of Phat Farm, All Def Digital, Global Grind, Def Pictures, Argyleculture, Tantris, American Classics
[[Music Producer]]
[[Author]] | spouse ={{marriage| [[Kimora Lee]]|1998|2009|end=div}} | children = 2 | relatives = [[Rev Run]] (brother)
[[Daniel Simmons, Jr.]] (brother) | website = [[Rush Communications]] | networth = {{profit}} [[$]]340 million (2011){{cite news|url=http://money.cnn.com/2011/04/26/smallbusiness/russell_simmons_small_business/index.htm |publisher=CNN |first=Tania |last=Padgett |title=Russell Simmons: Getting rich is so simple |date=April 26, 2011}} }} '''Russell Wendell Simmons''' (born October 4, 1957){{cite web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/russell-simmons-mn0000215647|title=Russell Simmons Biography |first=Steve |last=Huey|publisher=[[AllMusic.com]] |accessdate=February 25, 2016}} is an American [[entrepreneur]], [[record producer]], and [[author]]. The chair and CEO of Rush Communications, he co-founded the [[hip-hop music]] label [[Def Jam Recordings]]{{cite news |last=Aquino |first=Joann Natalia |title=Russell Simmons, 'godfather of hip hop,' comes to Seattle: Part of 20-city author tour |newspaper=[[Seattle Post-Intelligencer]] |date=February 20, 2011 |url=http://www.seattlepi.com/ae/books/article/Russell-Simmons-godfather-of-hip-hop-comes-to-1023483.php |accessdate=February 3, 2012}} and created the clothing fashion lines Phat Farm, Argyleculture, and [https://www.tantris.com/ Tantris]. Simmons's net worth was estimated at $340m in 2011. ==Early life and education== Simmons was born and raised in [[Queens, New York]].{{cite news|title=Russell Simmons Talks to PR.com - "My Religion is Compassion"|first=Allison|last=Kugel|authorlink=Allison Kugel|url=http://www.pr.com/article/1169|publisher=PR.com|date=January 3, 2011|accessdate=2011-05-28}} His father was a public school administrator and his mother was a New York [[City park]] administrator. His brothers are painter [[Danny Simmons|Daniel Simmons Jr.]], and [[Joseph Simmons|Rev Run]] of [[Run-DMC]]. In 1975, after graduating from [[August Martin High School]], Simmons briefly attended the [[City College of New York]] in [[Harlem]] where he met a young DJ/Bboy, Kurt Walker, who influenced him to participate in the [[Hip hop|hip-hop]] phenomenon.{{cite newspaper|url=http://www.washingtonblade.com/2013/08/29/russell-simmons-athletes-leading-our-cultural-awakening-lgbt-sports-issue-opinion/|title=Russell Simmons: Athletes leading our cultural awakening|newspaper=[[Washington Blade]]|publisher=[[Window Media LLC]]|location=Washington DC|date=August 29, 2013|accessdate=June 23, 2018}}{{cite book|first=Carrie|last=Golus|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=tC4qVYAiBy0C&pg=PA20|title=Russell Simmons: From Def Jam to Super Rich|publisher=Twenty-first Century Books|location=Minneapolis, Minnesota|date=2012|ISBN=978-0761381570}}{{cite news|first=Mindy|last=Fetterman|url=http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/money/companies/management/2007-05-13-exec-simmons-usat_N.htm|title=Today's Entrepreneur: Russell Simmons can't slow down|work=[[USA Today]]|publisher=[[Gannett Company]]|location=Mclean, Virginia|date=May 23, 2007|accessdate=June 23, 2018}}[http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=1466913&privcapId=916373 "Executive Profile: Russell Simmons"], Businessweek.com; accessed December 16, 2017.Rachel Kranz, [https://books.google.com/books?id=NCHX6P8ETI0C&pg=PA252&lpg=PA252&dq=russell+simmons+1975+high+school&source=bl&ots=_-Ejg_qA73&sig=Kk2FJsEI_Gm9g302vyMov_8IrIk&hl=en&sa=X&ei=_lVNUuO4HIfa8wS1n4CQDQ&ved=0CFsQ6AEwBw#v=onepage&q=russell%20simmons%201975%20high%20school&f=false "Simmons, Russell"], in ''African-American Business Leaders and Entrepreneurs'', Facts On File, 2004, p. 252. Upon hearing [[Eddie Cheeba]] perform in [[Harlem]] in 1977, Simmons knew that hip hop would be his career.{{cite book |author=Carrie Golus|title=Russell Simmons: From Def Jam to Super Rich|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=HBpbEHD8qAQC&pg=PA21|date=January 1, 2012|publisher=Twenty-First Century Books|isbn=978-0-7613-8157-0|page=21}} Simmons stated, "Hearing Cheeba in '77 made me feel like I had just witnessed the invention of the wheel." In 2014, [[Claremont Lincoln University]] awarded Russell Simmons an Honorary Doctorate Degree in Humane Letters for his work as chairman of the [[Foundation for Ethnic Understanding]] and for promoting mindfulness, compassion and interreligious collaboration in the public sphere.Wes Woods, [http://www.dailybulletin.com/social-affairs/20140518/russell-simmons-keynote-speaker-for-claremont-lincoln-university "Russell Simmons keynote speaker for Claremont Lincoln University"], ''Inland Valley Daily Bulletin'', May 18, 2014. ==Career== [[File:Russell Simmons.jpg|thumb|left|Russell Simmons]] Simmons co-founded Def Jam in 1983 with [[Rick Rubin]], who sold his share of the company for $120 million to [[Universal Music Group]] in 1996. In 1985, Simmons co-produced and appeared in the film ''[[Krush Groove]]''.{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0089444/fullcredits|title=Krush Groove (1985) : Full Cast & Crew|website=IMDb.com|accessdate=2016-02-01}} Simmons' company, Rush Communications Inc., includes over ten businesses and three non-profits. Simmons, with his partner [[Stan Lathan]], has also produced television hits [[HBO]]'s ''[[Def Comedy Jam]]'' and ''[[Def Poetry Jam]]'', and currently has a development deal with HBO.{{cite news|first=Patrick|last=Neate|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2011/jun/13/def-jam-launched-simmons-rubin |title=Def Jam Records launched by Russell Simmons and Rick Rubin|newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |publisher=[[Guardian Media Group]]|location=London, England|date=12 July 2011 |accessdate=1 February 2016}} In 1996, Simmons co-produced the hit film ''[[The Nutty Professor (1996 film)|The Nutty Professor]]'', starring [[Eddie Murphy]].{{cite book|first1=Russell |last1=Simmons|first2=Nelson |last2=George |title=Life and Def: Sex, Drugs, Money, and God|year=2001|publisher=[[Random House]]|location=New York City|isbn=0609606077}} In 2003, Simmons co-founded RushCard, a prepaid debit card provider.{{cite news|author=Introduction: About Us |url=https://www.rushcard.com/about-us |title=RushCard Prepaid Visa Card |accessdate=March 4, 2017}}{{cite magazine|first=Michelle|last=Toh|url=http://fortune.com/2016/08/29/rushcard-russell-simmons/ |title=Russell Simmons' Prepaid Debit Card Is Adding New Security Features |magazine=[[Fortune Magazine]]|publisher=[[Meredith Corporation]]|location=New York City|date=August 29, 2016|accessdate=March 4, 2017}} In 1992, Simmons launched the clothing line Phat Fashions LLC using the Phat Farm and Phat Baby labels. When Simmons first created Phat Fashions LLC, the clothing line was sold in a shop in the SoHo district of Manhattan. Simmons's connections with well known rap artists helped to promote the clothing line to a wide audience. The influence of designers such as [[Ralph Lauren]] and [[Tommy Hilfiger]] gave the clothing line a classic look and feel. Phat Fashions encompassed not only hip hop clothing for men, but also women and children. Phat Fashions grew into a lifestyle brand with the addition of jewelry, perfume, and other merchandise. Phat Fashions LLC sold merchandise in two stores in New York and Montreal as well as online at [http://www.phatfarm.com www.phatfarm.com]. In addition, the clothing line was carried by some 3,000 retailers in the United States.http://www.fundinguniverse.com/company-histories/phat-fashions-llc-history/ In 2004, Simmons sold Phat Farm and Baby Phat to the Kellwood Company for $140 million.https://www.racked.com/2016/1/11/10737956/hip-hop-brands-fubu-sean-john-rocawear-phat-farm Russell Simmons, along with his brothers Danny Simmons and Joseph "Rev Run" Simmons, founded the [http://rushphilanthropic.org/ Rush Philanthropic Arts Foundation] in 1995. The purpose of the Foundation is to provide art education and support to under-serviced youth by helping people of color access the arts and by providing exhibition opportunities. The Foundation serves about 3,000 students annually and maintains two galleries. The Rush Arts Gallery in Chelsea, Manhattan and the Corridor Gallery in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn exhibit the work of more than 100 community and emerging artists.http://rushphilanthropic.org/about/ ==Personal life== ===Marriage=== Simmons and model [[Kimora Lee]] met in November 1992. They married on December 20, 1998,{{cite magazine|first1=Stephen M.|last=Silverman|url=https://people.com/celebrity/russell-kimora-lee-simmons-split/|title=Russell, Kimora Lee Simmons Split|magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]]|publisher=[[Meredith Corporation]]|location=New York City|date=March 31, 2006|accessdate=June 23, 2018}} on the island of [[Saint Barthélemy]]. They have two daughters, Ming Lee (born 2000) and Aoki Lee (born 2002). In March 2006, Simmons announced that he and Lee had ended their relationship; they officially divorced two years later.{{cite magazine|url=https://people.com/celebrity/kimora-lee-files-for-divorce-from-russell-simmons/|title=Kimora Lee Files for Divorce from Russell Simmons|magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]]|publisher=[[Meredith Corporation]]|location=New York City|date=March 26, 2008|accessdate=June 23, 2018}} ===Beliefs=== Simmons describes himself as a Christian yogi, with a love and respect for all religions. Simmons practices a method of yoga known as [[Jivamukti Yoga]],{{cite news|first=Sheila|last=Marikar|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/17/fashion/russell-simmons-yoga-los-angeles-tantris.html|title=Russell Simmons, the Yoga King of Los Angeles|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|publisher=New York Times Company|location=New York City|date=November 16, 2016|accessdate=June 23, 2018}} which encourages vegetarianism and social and environmental activism. Simmons is a practitioner of [[Transcendental Meditation technique|Transcendental Meditation]] (TM){{cite web|first=Alexa|last=Valiente|url=https://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/russell-simmons-meditation-changed-life-relationship-donald-trump/story?id=47036252|title=Russell Simmons on how meditation changed his life, his relationship with Donald Trump|website=[[ABC News]]|date=April 26, 2017|accessdate=June 23, 2018}} and a supporter of the [[David Lynch Foundation|David Lynch Foundation for Consciousness-Based Education and World Peace]], which was established to ensure that any child in America who wants to learn and practice TM can do so.{{cite web|first=Russell|last=Simmons|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/russell-simmons/why-i-meditate_b_474689.html|title=Why I meditate|website=[[Huffington Post]]|publisher=[[Huffington Post Media Group]]|location=New York City|date=February 24, 2010|accessdate=June 23, 2018}} ==Social activism== Simmons has been vegan since 1999 and advocates [[Ahimsa]] and [[veganism]], citing [[animal rights]] along with the environmental and health benefits.[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7Ag5wDXEsX8 "Russell Simmons on his vegan diet, Obama and yoga"] at Youtube. Simmons is a supporter of [[Farm Sanctuary]], an organization working to end cruelty to farm animals.{{cite news| url=http://yourlife.usatoday.com/mind-soul/doing-good/kindness/post/2009/11/Thanksgiving-getting-a-remake-courtesy-of-Russell-Simmons/8477/1 | work=USA Today | title=Thanksgiving getting a remake courtesy of Russell Simmons | date=November 13, 2009}} [[People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals]] awarded him the 2001 PETA Humanitarian Award and the 2011 Person of the Year Award.Cookie Lommell, [https://books.google.com/books?id=4laORCuvf9UC&pg=PA84&lpg=PA84&dq=Russell+Simmons+PETA+humanitarian+award&source=bl&ots=LuJ1kf-RCa&sig=aHrDmyM5nHbUK1f7v0c3AxxARGQ&hl=en&ei=SiTmTtzRL4mzsALri-DvBQ&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=4&ved=0CDsQ6AEwAw#v=onepage&q=Russell%20Simmons%20PETA%20humanitarian%20award&f=false ''Russell Simmons''] Infobase Publishing 2007.Calvin Stovall, "[http://www.bet.com/news/music/2011/12/19/russell-simmons-honored-by-peta.html Russell Simmons Honored by PETA"], BET, 19 December 2011. In 2009, Simmons organized thousands of protestors and hip-hop celebrities in front of city hall demanding change of the harsh sentencing of the [[Rockefeller Drug Laws]].{{cite web|last1=AbduSalaam|first1=Ismael|title=Russell Simmons Leads NY Protest Against Rockefeller Drug Laws|url=https://allhiphop.com/2009/03/25/russell-simmons-leads-ny-protest-against-rockefeller-drug-laws/|website=allhiphop.com|accessdate=19 June 2017}} Simmons became chairman of the board of the [[Foundation for Ethnic Understanding]] in 2002.{{cite news |first= Anthony |last=Ramirez |title=Backstage With Six Rabbis, Six Imams and No 'Kumbaya' |publisher=''The New York Times'' |date=April 13, 2008 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2008/04/13/nyregion/13bias.html |accessdate=June 3, 2013}} In May 2009, he was appointed Goodwill Ambassador for the [[UN Slavery Memorial]] at the [[United Nations]] to honor the victims of slavery and the [[Atlantic slave trade|transatlantic slave trade]] by UN Secretary-General [[Ban Ki-moon]].[https://www.un.org/News/Press/docs//2009/sgsm12258.doc.htm "Secretary-General pledges to fill gap in knowledge about causes, effects of transatlantic slave trade"]. United Nations. In a similar vein, Simmons is a supporter of the [[Somaly Mam|Somaly Mam Foundation]],{{cite web|last=|first=|title=Russell Simmons Got A Joyful Hamptons' Social Life, Hosts Somaly Mam Foundation Benefit|url=http://globalgrind.com/entertainment/russell-simmons-cover-social-life-magazine-melissa-george-photos|publisher=Global Grind|accessdate=August 15, 2011}} and was honored at their 2011 gala dinner.{{cite web|title=2011 East Coast Gala|url=http://www.somaly.org/events/2011-somaly-mam-foundation-east-coast-gala|publisher=Somaly Mam Foundation|accessdate=19 September 2011}} Simmons officially endorses the second [[Muslim Jewish Conference]] 2011. Together with Rabbi [[Marc Schneier]] he served as the official [[patron]] of the conference held July 2011 in [[Kiev]], [[Ukraine]]. In 2011, he took part in the [[Occupy Wall Street]] protests, visiting the protesters at [[Zuccotti Park]] often and for many consecutive days. Simmons is also a longtime supporter for [[gay rights]]. He encourages [[marriage equality]].{{cite news| url=http://voices.washingtonpost.com/postpartisan/2011/03/russell_simmons_gay_marriage_a.html | work=The Washington Post | title=Russell Simmons, gay marriage and Maryland}} In 2011, when the retail corporation [[Lowe's]] [[All-American Muslim#Sponsorship controversy|withdrew funding]] from the show ''[[All-American Muslim]]'', Simmons promised to pay [[the Learning Channel]] for any revenue lost.{{cite news|title=Waging a One-Man War on American Muslims|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/12/17/us/on-religion-a-one-man-war-on-american-muslims.html?_r=2&src=tp&smid=fb-share|author= Samuel G. Freedman|date=2011-12-16|work=The New York Times}} In 2012, Simmons supported Ohio congressman [[Dennis Kucinich]]'s re-election campaign, appearing with the politician at various speaking events.{{cite news|url=http://www.toledoblade.com/Politics/2012/03/02/Hip-hop-mogul-Russell-Simmons-to-appear-with-Kucinich.html | work=Toledo Blade | title=Hip hop mogul Russell Simmons to appear with Kucinich}} In November 2013, he pledged support for New York's mayoral candidate [[Bill de Blasio]] in recognition of his support for animal rights.[https://twitter.com/UncleRUSH/statuses/396387643237228544 "proud to support @deBlasioNYC to be NYC's next mayor as I know he supports animal rights and will stop abuse of the horses in Central Park"], Monday, November 1, 2013. In 2015, Simmons criticized his friend, real estate developer and future United States president [[Donald Trump]], in an open letter after Trump called for Muslim immigrants to be barred from entering the United States.{{cite news |last1= Haberman |first1= Maggie |last2= Eder |first2= Steve |date=21 December 2015 |title=Rise of Donald Trump Divides Black Celebrities He Calls His Friends |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/12/22/us/politics/donald-trump-african-americans.html |newspaper= [[New York Times]] |access-date= 21 December 2015}} In 2017, Simmons was listed by UK-based company Richtopia at number 23 in the list of 200 Most Influential Social-Entrepreneurs and Philanthropists Worldwide.{{cite web|url=https://richtopia.com/inspirational-people/top-200-philanthropists-social-entrepreneurs|title=Philanthropists & Social Entrepreneurs Top 200: From Elon Musk to Melinda Gates, These Are the Most Influential Do-Gooders in the World|work=Richtopia|accessdate=30 March 2017}}{{cite web|url=https://www.naij.com/1096829-200-influential-philanthropists-world-see-nigerian-list.html|title=200 most influential philanthropists in the world|work=Naij|accessdate=31 March 2017}} ==Harriet Tubman sex tape controversy== In August 2013, Simmons launched the controversial "Harriet Tubman Sex Tape" parody video on his YouTube channel, "All Def Digital", which led to public outrage and many critics demanding an apology. The video featured an actress portraying the great abolitionist [[Harriet Tubman]] (1820-1913) having sex with her [[slave owner]] with the intent of filming the act and blackmailing him to convince him to work on the [[Underground Railroad]].{{cite web|title=Russell Simmons and the Harriet Tubman Sex Tape|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YYmQM1NAaWY|website=[[The Young Turks]]|publisher=[[YouTube]]|location=San Bruno, California|date=August 15, 2013|accessdate=December 8, 2017}} Women from his own community, as well as filmmaker [[Spike Lee]],{{Cite news |first=Melia|last=Robinson |url=http://www.businessinsider.com/spike-lee-slams-russell-simmons-for-producing-mock-harriet-tubman-sex-tape-2013-8|title=Spike Lee Slams Russell Simmons For Producing Mock Harriet Tubman Sex Tape|work=[[Business Insider]]|publisher=[[Axel Springer SE]]|location=New York City|date=August 15, 2013|access-date=December 8, 2017|language=en}} were offended by the controversial comedy sketch.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2013/aug/16/russell-simmons-defamed-harriet-tubman |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |date=August 16, 2013 |title=Russell Simmons, you defamed not just Harriet Tubman but all black women |first=Kimberly |last=Foster}} ''Rolling Stone'' published Simmons' apology for the parody in which he said: {{quote|I'm a very liberal person with thick skin. My first impression of the Harriet Tubman piece was that it was about what one of actors said in the video, that 162 years later, there's still tremendous injustice," Simmons wrote. "And with Harriet Tubman outwitting the slave master? I thought it was politically correct. Silly me. I can now understand why so many people are upset. I would never condone violence against women in any form, and for all of those I offended, I am sincerely sorry.{{Cite news|first=RJ|last=Cubarrubia|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/russell-simmons-apologizes-for-harriet-tubman-sex-tape-20130815|title=Russell Simmons Apologizes for Harriet Tubman 'Sex Tape'|work=[[Rolling Stone]]|publisher=Wenner Media LLC|date=August 15, 2013|access-date=December 8, 2017|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=}}}} Despite his apology in 2013, the nature of shareable digital media has allowed the comedy video to continue to circulate on YouTube and around the web.{{cite web|last=StraightFromTheA1 (YouTube)|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=78OvnOmZvTg&t=64s|title=Harriet Tubman Sex Tape Controversy (Funny? Or Disrespectful?)|publisher=[[YouTube]]|date=August 15, 2013|accessdate=December 8, 2017}} ==Sexual misconduct and assault allegations== {{See also|Weinstein effect}} ===Background=== In November 2017, model Keri Claussen Khalighi accused Simmons of sexually assaulting her in 1991, when she was seventeen. Simmons and [[Brett Ratner]], who was accused by Khalighi of watching them without intervening when she asked for his help, both deny that the encounter was non-consensual.{{cite news|first=Ben|last=Beaumont-Thomas|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2017/nov/20/russell-simmons-accused-of-sexual-assault-alongside-brett-ratner|title=Russell Simmons accused of sexual assault alongside Brett Ratner|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|publisher=[[Guardian Media Group]]|location=London, England|date=20 November 2017|accessdate=23 June 2018}} As the allegation was covered in the press, [[Terry Crews]] accused Simmons of attempting to influence him to take back sexual assault allegations that Crews had recently brought up against film executive Adam Venit, asking that Crews "give him a pass ... ask that he be reinstated." Crews posted a screenshot of the alleged e-mail he had received from Simmons on his Twitter account.{{cite news|first=Soniya|last=Kelley|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/la-et-entertainment-news-updates-russell-simmons-to-terry-crews-give-1511114119-htmlstory.html|title=Terry Crews says Russell Simmons asked him to give target of sexual-assault allegations 'a pass'|newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]]|publisher=[[Tronc]]|location=Los Angeles, California|date=November 19, 2017|accessdate=June 23, 2018}}{{Cite news|first=Gwilym|last=Mumford|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2017/oct/11/actor-terry-crews-sexually-assaulted-by-hollywood-executive|title=Actor Terry Crews: I was sexually assaulted by Hollywood executive |work=[[The Guardian]]|publisher=[[Guardian Media Group]]|location=London, England| date=11 October 2017|access-date=29 November 2017|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-41580861 |title=Brooklyn Nine-Nine actor claims groping|work=[[BBC News]]|location=London, England|date=11 October 2017|access-date=23 June 2018 |language=en-GB}}{{cite web|first=Lexy|last=Perez|title=Terry Crews Details Alleged Sexual Assault by WME's Adam Venit|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/terry-crews-details-alleged-sexual-assault-by-wmes-adam-venit-1058506|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|publisher=[[Eldridge Industries]]|location=London, England|date=November 15, 2017|accessdate=16 November 2017}} On November 30, 2017, writer [[Jenny Lumet]] claimed that Simmons had assaulted her in 1991. In response, Simmons said he would step down from his positions with his businesses.{{cite news|first1=Jenny|last1=Lumet|authorlink=Jenny Lumet|title=Writer Jenny Lumet: Russell Simmons Sexually Violated Me (Guest Column)|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/writer-jenny-lumet-russell-simmons-sexually-violated-me-guest-column-1062934|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|publisher=[[Eldridge Industries]]|location=Los Angeles, California|date=November 30, 2017|accessdate=June 23, 2018}} On the same day, HBO announced that they would be removing Simmons's name and his likeness from his stand-up comedy specials starting with the December 1 episode. On December 13, 2017, ''[[The Los Angeles Times]]'' published an investigative report in which five women accused Simmons of sexual misconduct; including an alleged rape. On the same day, ''[[The New York Times]]'' published the accounts of four other women who accused Simmons of inappropriate conduct; including three alleged rapes. In response to the allegations, Simmons stated he "never had a sexual encounter that was not consensual or lawful. Ever."{{cite news|first1=Daniel|last1=Miller|first2=Amy|last2=Kaufman|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/la-et-entertainment-news-updates-nypd-opens-investigation-into-russell-1513286033-htmlstory.html|title=NYPD opens investigation into Russell Simmons as more sexual assault allegations surface|newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]]|publisher=[[Tronc]]|location=Los Angeles, California|date=December 14, 2017|accessdate=June 23, 2018}} On February 9, 2018, Simmons denied the allegations to ''[[Rolling Stone]]'', saying (in part), "I vehemently deny all the allegations made against me. They have shocked me to my core as I have never been abusive or violent in any way in my relations with women. I am blessed to have shared extraordinary relationships, whether through work or love, with many great women and I have enormous respect for the women's movement worldwide and their struggle for respect, dignity, equality and power. I am devastated by any reason I may have given to anyone to say or think of me in the ways that are currently being described. I have separated myself from my businesses and charities in order to not become a distraction." {{cite magazine|first=Elias|last=Leight|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/russell-simmons-sexual-assault-allegations-a-timeline-w516384|title=Russell Simmons Sexual Assault Allegations: A Timeline|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|publisher=Wenner Media LLC|location=New York City|date=February 9, 2018|accessdate=June 23, 2018}} On April 25, 2018, Jennifer Jarosik, a filmmaker who alleged Simmons raped her, dropped her lawsuit. The suit was dismissed with prejudice, meaning Jarosik can not refile allegations in court.{{cite newspaper|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/people/2018/04/25/russell-simmons-scores-win-accuser-jennifer-jarosik-drops-lawsuit/552026002/|title=Russell Simmons scores a win, accuser Jennifer Jarosik drops lawsuit|newspaper=[[USA Today]]|publisher=[[Gannett Company]]|location=April 25, 2018|accessdate=June 23, 2018|agency=[[Associated Press]]}} ===Accusers=== A number of women, some of whom were aged seventeen at the time of the alleged incidents, have accused Simmons of sexual harassment, assault or rape: ====Sexual harassment or assault==== Women who said they had been sexually harassed or assaulted (including attempted rape) by Simmons include: #[[Kelly Cutrone]], publicist and author.{{cite web|first1=Rebecca|last1=Lewis|title=Strike actor says Harvey Weinstein 'offered sex in return for furthering career'|url=https://metro.co.uk/2017/10/16/strike-star-amber-anderson-claims-harvey-weinstein-offered-sex-in-return-for-furthering-her-career-7004835/|website=[[Metro (British newspaper)|Metro]]|publisher=[[DMG Media]]|location=London, England|date=16 October 2017|accessdate=23 June 2018}} #Keri Claussen Khalighi, model.{{cite news|first1=Daniel|last1=Miller|first2=Amy|last2=Kaufman|first3=Victoria|last3=Kim|url=http://www.latimes.com/business/hollywood/la-fi-brett-ratner-russell-simmons-20171119-htmlstory.html|title=Russell Simmons and Brett Ratner face new allegations of sexual misconduct|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|publisher=[[Tronc]]|location=Los Angeles, California|date=November 19, 2017|accessdate=June 23, 2018}} #Lisa Kirk, an acquaintance of Simmons. #Toni Sallie, music journalist. #[[Amanda Seales]], actor and comedian (verbal harassment). #Natashia Williams-Blach, actress. #[[Luann de Lesseps]], reality television personality{{cite magazine|first=Maria|last=Pasquini|url=http://people.com/tv/luann-de-lesseps-russell-simmons-groping-allegation/|title=Luann de Lesseps Accuses Russell Simmons of Groping Her in an Elevator: 'He Was Just a Pig'|magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]]|publisher=[[Meredith Corporation]]|location=London, England|date=April 8, 2018|accessdate=April 9, 2018}} ====Rape==== Women who said they had been raped by Simmons include: #[[Jenny Lumet]], screenwriter. #Sherri Hines, musician.{{cite magazine|first=Melody|last=Chiu|title=13 Women Total Accuse Music Producer Russell Simmons of Sexual Misconduct — Everything They've Said|url=http://people.com/music/russell-simmons-sexual-misconduct-allegations-complete-list/|magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]]|publisher=[[Meredith Corporation]]|location=New York City|date=March 26, 2018|accessdate=June 23, 2018}} #Tina Baker, singer-turned-lawyer. #Drew Dixon, former music recording executive. #Jennifer Jarosik, filmmaker.{{cite web|first=Anastasia|last=Tsioulcas|title=Russell Simmons Publicly Accused Of Rape By A 6th Woman|url=https://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2018/01/25/580629581/russell-simmons-publicly-accused-of-rape-by-a-6th-woman|work=[[NPR]]|location=Washington DC|date=January 25, 2018|accessdate=June 23, 2018}} ===Resignation=== After the third assault allegation was published in a guest column in [[The Hollywood Reporter]] November 2017 by Jenny Lumet, Simmons stepped down from his role in the label Def Jam Records, along with his yoga lifestyle brand, other media properties and CNNMoney. Jenny Lumet is the daughter of filmmaker Sidney Lumet and the granddaughter of singer and civil rights activist [[Lena Horne]]. Lumet wrote: "As a woman of color, I cannot express how wrenching it is to write this about a successful man of color. ... I feel a pang to protect your daughters. I don't think you are inclined to protect mine."https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/writer-jenny-lumet-russell-simmons-sexually-violated-me-guest-column-1062934{{Cite news|first=Daniel|last=Victor|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/30/arts/russell-simmons-sexual-harassment.html|title=Russell Simmons Steps Down From Businesses After Sexual Misconduct Report|work=[[The New York Times]]|publisher=New York Times Company|location=New York City|date=November 30, 2017|access-date=2017-12-08|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}{{Cite news|first=Chloe|last=Melas|url=http://money.cnn.com/2017/11/30/media/russell-simmons-sexual-assault-stepping-down-companies/index.html|title=Russell Simmons steps down after sexual assault allegation|work=[[CNNMoney]]|date=November 30, 2017|access-date=December 8, 2017}} [[HBO]] decided to remove Russell Simmons' name from "All Def Comedy," a series he created to launch and showcase emerging comedians.{{Cite news|first=Martha|last=Ross|url=http://www.mercurynews.com/2017/11/30/russell-simmons-facing-third-assault-allegation-steps-down-from-companies/|title=HBO cuts ties with Russell Simmons after third assault allegation|newspaper=[[The Mercury News]]|publisher=[[Bay Area News Group]]|location=San Jose, California|date=November 30, 2017|access-date=December 8, 2017|language=en-US}} ==Bibliography== Simmons has written several books that reflect his experiences in the entertainment business and his personal beliefs. * ''Life and Def: Sex, Drugs, Money, + God'', published September 24, 2001 * ''Russell Simmons Def Poetry Jam on Broadway … and More'', published March 29, 2005 * ''Do You! 12 Laws to Access the Power in You to Achieve Happiness and Success'', published April 10, 2008. * ''Super Rich: Inside and Out'', published November 1, 2011 * ''Success Through Stillness'', published March 11, 2014 * ''The Happy Vegan'', published November 4, 2015 ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} == External links == {{Wikiquote}} * {{imdb name|5432}} {{Def Jam Recordings}} {{Def Jam South}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Simmons, Russell}} [[Category:1957 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:African-American businesspeople]] [[Category:African-American fashion designers]] [[Category:American fashion designers]] [[Category:African-American non-fiction writers]] [[Category:American businesspeople in retailing]] [[Category:American business writers]] [[Category:American chief executives]] [[Category:American computer businesspeople]] [[Category:American fashion businesspeople]] [[Category:American health activists]] [[Category:American music industry executives]] [[Category:Businesspeople from New York City]] [[Category:LGBT rights activists from the United States]] [[Category:People from Queens, New York]] [[Category:People from Saddle River, New Jersey]] [[Category:Television producers from New York City]] [[Category:Transcendental Meditation practitioners]] [[Category:Veganism activists]] [[Category:Writers from New York City]] [[Category:Activists from New York (state)]] [[Category:Def Jam Recordings]]

'''''Sheikh''''', also rendered as '''''Sheik''''', '''''Shaykh''''', '''''Shaikh''''', '''''Shekh''''', '''''Cheikh''''', '''''Šeih''''', '''''Šejh''''', '''''Şeyh''''' and other variants ([[Arabic language|Arabic]]: {{rtl-lang|ar|شيخ}}, ''shaykh''; [[plural|pl.]] {{rtl-lang|ar|شيوخ}} ''shuyūkh''), is a word or [[honorific]] term in the [[Arabic language]] that literally means "[[Elder (administrative title)|elder]]." It is commonly used to designate an elder of a [[tribe]], a revered wise man, or an [[Ulema|Islamic scholar]]. Although the title generally refers to a male, a very small number of female sheikhs have also existed in history.<ref>''People of India'', Sir Herbert Risely, {{ISBN|9788120612655}}</ref>
==Foreign Muslim origin== In [[South Asia]], the term Shaikh may refer to immigrants from [[Middle East]] origins but they are a community that exist mostly in [[Pakistan]], and also in the regions of [[Punjab region|Punjab]], and [[Jammu and Kashmir]]. Most of the Shaikhs are of native origin.
==Native Muslim origin== Many upper and lower [[Hindu]]s that converted to [[Islam]] in [[South Asia]] adopted the title of Shaikh. For example; the [[Kashmiri Pandit|Pandits]] of [[Kashmir]] and [[Kayastha]]s in [[Uttar Pradesh]] [[Bihar]] adopted the Shaikh title after their conversion to Islam. Millions of Dalits also accepted the Shaikh title in India.
==Sub-divisions== The subdivisions of the Shaikh include: * Shaikh [[Qidwai]], descendants of the Qazi Qidwa, a son of the Sultans of Rum.<ref name="auto">{{cite journal|url=http://journals.sagepub.com/doi/pdf/10.1177/001946467901600307|title=Book Reviews : IMTIAZ AHMAD (Ed.), Caste and Social Stratification among Muslims in India (2nd edn.), Manohar, 1978, Pp. 318, Rs 65. IMTIAZ AHMAD (Ed.), Family, Kinship, and Marriage among Muslims in India, Manohar, 1976, Pp. 367, Rs 75|first=Veena|last=Das|date=1 July 1979|publisher=|journal=The Indian Economic & Social History Review|volume=16|issue=3|pages=367–368|accessdate=1 December 2018|doi=10.1177/001946467901600307}}</ref> * Shaikh [[Hashmi]], members of the [[Banu Hashim]] clan of the [[Quraysh (tribe)|Banu Quraish]] tribe. The Islamic prophet, [[Muhammad]] belonged to this clan. Usually carry the title [[Sayyid]] or [[Sharif]].<ref name="auto"/> * Shaikh [[Siddiqui]], descendants of [[Abu Bakar]], the first [[Caliph|Khalifa]] of [[Islam]].<ref name="auto"/> * * Shaikh [[Osmani|Usmani]] (Osmani), descendants of [[Uthman Ibn Affan]] the third [[Caliph|Khalifa]] of [[Islam]]<ref name="auto"/> * Shaikh [[Farooqi]], Honorific reverence to [[Umar|Umar Farooq Bin Al-Khattab]].<ref name="auto"/><ref name="auto"/>
==Prominent people== * [[Ehsan Danish]], urdu poet of born in [[Kandhla]] * [[Sachal Sarmast]], Sufi Saint. * [[Javed Sheikh]], Pakistani Actor. * [[Nawazuddin Siddiqui]], Indian actor. * [[Emraan Hashmi]], Indian actor. * [[Huma Qureshi (actress)|Huma Qureshi]], Indian actress. * [[Shakeel Siddiqui]], Pakistani comedian, stage artist and performer. * [[Farooq Sheikh]], Indian actor ([[Bollywood]] and theatre), television presenter and philanthropist. * [[Shaikh Ayaz]], Sindhi poet of Pakistan. * [[Rafi Ahmed Kidwai]], a politician, an Indian independence activist and a socialist, sometimes described as an Islamic socialist. * [[Akhlaqur Rahman Kidwai]], a prominent Indian chemist and politician. * [[Sheikh Mujibur Rahman]] Bengali statesman and leader of the Bangladesh independence movement.
== See also == * [[Sheikh]] * [[Shaikhzada]] * [[Siddiqui]] * [[Qidwai]] * [[Sindhi Shaikh]] * [[Punjabi Shaikh]] * [[Muslim Kayasths]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=July 2018}} {{expert-subject|date=July 2015|reason=Most things in this article are wrong. Kummer tried to arrange with the regime. See German Wikipedia for further details.}} [[File:SiegfriedAdolfKummerfromhisbookHeiligeRunenmacht.jpg|thumb| Siegfried Adolf Kummer from his book "[[Heilige Runenmacht]]"]] '''Siegfried Adolf Kummer''' (born 24 September 1899 in [[Radeberg]], died 1977 in [[Dresden]]) was a [[German mystic]] and [[Germanic revivalism|Germanic revivalist]]. He is also most well known for his revivalism and use of the [[Armanen runes]] row. He, along with [[Friedrich Bernhard Marby]], were imprisoned during the [[Third Reich]] for being unauthorised occultists.
==Biography== [[File:HeilageRunenmachtOLD.jpg|thumb|left|Original 1932 cover of Siegfried Adolf Kummer’ book "[[Heilige Runenmacht]]"]] Little is known of his life or of his fate in the wake of the events of the [[Nazi era]].
Kummer, along with [[Friedrich Bernhard Marby]], were criticized by name in a report made to Heinrich Himmler by his chief esoteric runologist [[Karl Maria Wiligut]]. [[Nicholas Goodrick-Clarke|Goodrick-Clarke]] states that they were ''"censured by Wiligut in his capacity as Himmler's counsellor on magical and religious subjects for bringing the holy Aryan heritage into disrepute and riducule and this criticism may have led to Marby's harsh treatment in the Third Reich."''<ref>'[[The Occult Roots of Nazism]]' by [[Nicholas Goodrick-Clarke]], page162</ref><ref>Weisthor (i.e. Wiligut) to Himmler, letter dated 2 May 1934, [[Bundesarchiv]], [[Koblenz]], Himmler Nachlass 19.</ref> But what his fate was is unknown. At least one report<ref>Flowers, Stephen E. – Introduction to his English translation (Texas, February 1993) of Kummers 'Runen-Magie', 1933</ref> has him fleeing Nazi Germany in exile to South America.
In 1927, Kummer founded a "runic school" called ''Runa'', associated with the summer school [[Bielatal Bärenstein]] of [[Georg Richter|Georg]] and [[Alfred Richter]]. The runic exercises, comparable to the "runic gymnastics" of [[Friedrich Bernhard Marby|Marby]], runic dancing and runic songs were taught. Kummer held that :"As a we now can receive various waves by means of a radio device, so the German by means of runic exercises and dances can regulate the influx of invisible ethereal cosmic waves. Those who dismiss this as impossible will never be able to detect thought waves, because they are in disharmony with the cosmic All, and are impeded by [[Racial hygiene|racially foreign blood]]."<ref>"Wie man nun im Radioapperat verschiedene Wellen aufnehmen kann, so kann der Germane durch Runenübungen und Tänze ebenfalls den Zustrom von unsichtbaren, feinstofflichen Allwellen regulieren. Wer dies für unmöglich hält, wird nie Gedankenwellen aufnehmen können, denn er schwingt mit dem kosmischen All in Disharmonie, ist durch fremdrassiges Blut belastet."{{cite web |url=http://www.antiqbook.de/boox/hans/502844.shtml |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2 January 2007 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070927224946/http://www.antiqbook.de/boox/hans/502844.shtml |archivedate=27 September 2007 |df= }}</ref>
==Written works== *''Heilige Runenmacht'' (1932) *''Runen-Magie''(1933) *''Runen – Raunen'': Eine Sammlg eingesandter Berichte nach d. Runenkunden *''Walhall ''
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20091027105720/http://geocities.com/odinistlibrary/OLArticles/Articles/SiegfriedAdolfKummer.htm The Life of Kummer] *[https://archive.is/20130105190259/http://dispatch.opac.ddb.de/DB=4.1/SET=13/TTL=1/CMD?ACT=SRCHA&IKT=8500&SRT=YOP&TRM=Siegfried+Adolf+Kummer Works by and about Siegfried Adolf Kummer] in the [[German National Library]] catalogue
